subject: Public Speaking
title: Beta Blockers and Performance
description: A fast breakdown of Beta Blockers and Performance for builders.

hook.text: Many professional musicians take beta blockers before performances. They block adrenaline's effect on the body.

buildup.text: Beta blockers prevent trembling hands, racing heart, and shaky voice. They treat symptoms, not the underlying fear.

discovery.text: Studies show they improve performance in tasks requiring fine motor control, like playing violin or surgery.

twist.text: But they don't help with cognitive symptoms â€” blanking on words, losing focus, or spiraling thoughts persist.

climax.text: Beta blockers are a band-aid, not a cure. They manage the body's symptoms while leaving the mind's patterns intact.

quiz.question: What do beta blockers NOT help with in public speaking?
options: Cognitive symptoms like blanking on words
